result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Bernard James Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Bernard James Miller was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $829.25 fine/costs.    Pay obligation by 8-15-16 or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan by 8-15-16 and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.    Pay obligation by 8-15-16 or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan by 8-15-16 and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.


Any contraband seized in this matter is ordered forfeited.

judgments.dispoDesc:
DE pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  $1079.25 fine/costs.    Pay obligation by August 15, 2016 or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan by August 15th, 2016 and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  DE must provide DNA sample and pay $250 surcharge which is included in above fine.
Any contraband seized in this case is ordered forfeited.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Judge Robert Eaton appears by phone and DE waives his right to have the Judge in the courtroom in person.
DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Atty Marcoux presents agreement which is joint recommendation.   Atty Jarvis verfies this is the agreement.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  $1079.25 fine/costs.    Pay obligation by August 15, 2016 or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan by August 15th, 2016 and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.  DE must provide DNA sample and pay $250 surcharge which is included in above fine.
Any contraband seized in this case is ordered forfeited.
Ct #2 is dismissed.
Warrant in this matter is ordered quashed by the court.

Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in court in custody, with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Jarvis presents motion to supress all statements given by DE prior to being Mirandized.  DA Poquette makes statement.  Court grants Motion to Supress.
Court orders the State to comply with any motions for discovery.
DE states he is being released from prison on June 14th.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Jury trial scheduled June 7th 2016. 9:00 am.

Attorney Martin Jarvis in court appearing by phone. Judge Robert Eaton also appearing by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin in Sawyer County Courtroom.  DE does not appear from prison- Atty Jarvis states DE approved him appearing on behalf of DE.   OFF THE RECORD.
Motion hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
State to produce DE for next hearing.
Warrant for Nicholas Bernard James Miller- failure to appear
Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Start Forfeiture Proceedings  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:36 PM   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Johansen waived reading of information and entered plea of not guilty requests a motion hearing be set.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:48 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances. Officer Simpson called - sworn by deputy clerk - examined Atty Poquette. Officer refreshes his recollection by reviewing his report.  Atty Poquette continues examination of the witness.  Court finds witness has identified the defendant.  Atty Johansen cross-examination.  State makes arguement requests bind over.  Atty Johansen makes arguement.

COURT:  finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial  Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Bernard James Miller in court, in custody appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.    NG Plea entered by court on Count #2.   Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Absolute Sobriety.  No drug use without a valid prescription
Defendant appered in custody via video - voluntarily.  Court sets bail and PC was found previously.
